text: The Dundalk International is a greyhound racing competition held annually at Dundalk Stadium in Dundalk, County Louth, Ireland. It was held at the Dundalk Ramparts Greyhound Stadium from 1968 until 2000 until the track closed in 2000 and then it returned in 2004 after the new track was built. It is a prestigious invitation event held for Ireland's leading greyhounds and also attracts some of the UK's top hounds. The event is one of the richest one off races in Ireland (€20,000 in 2016 & 2017) and is an integral part of the Irish greyhound racing calendar after being inaugurated in 1968. ==Past winners== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ |- !width=50|Year !width=180|Winner !width=300|Breeding !width=80|Time !width=250|Trainer !width=50|SP !width=100|Notes |- !1968 |Not Flashing ||Prairie Flash -
